# Advent Sunday in Noblessner 2025

![Advent Sunday in Noblessner 2025]()

Noblessner’s First Advent Event is Back!  
**On 30 November at 16:00, the lights of Noblessner’s Christmas Tree will switched on festively.**  
The Christmas tree decoration by [Shishi](https://www.shishi.ee/) designers is once again unique — in addition to ornaments, the tree is adorned with 22,000 twinkling LED lights.

After the lights are switched on, the Estonian National Opera [boys’ choir](https://opera.ee/en/about-us/meist/poistekoor/) JUHANID will perform, with [OTT LEPLAND](https://www.fullhouseagency.com/artists/ott-lepland-eng/) as soloist!

**At 16:30**, a [boat parade](https://www.facebook.com/events/1321345953073821/?acontext=%7B%22ref%22%3A%2252%22%2C%22action_history%22%3A%22[%7B%5C%22surface%5C%22%3A%5C%22share_link%5C%22%2C%5C%22mechanism%5C%22%3A%5C%22share_link%5C%22%2C%5C%22extra_data%5C%22%3A%7B%5C%22invite_link_id%5C%22%3A25086758894327348%7D%7D]%22%7D) will start from the Noblessner aquatorium! For the second year in a row, Christmas-lit kayak and SUP riders will travel through the Noblessner and Seaplane Harbour marinas, offering spectators a mystical and visually enchanting spectacle. The paddlers’ route is staged and includes performances, such as Kayak Realm’s “Paddle Party.”

**At 16:30**, the local group Kopli Sörk again invites all neighbours from Põhja-Tallinn and friends from across the city to Noblessner for a [Christmas Tree Run](https://www.facebook.com/events/850806107907903)! The start is next to the Christmas tree.

**Also in Noblessner:**  
11:00–17:00 – [SHISHI](https://www.shishi.ee/) (Peetri 3): a rich collection of Christmas ornaments; the stores are open!  
12:00–22:00 – magical [Christmas World at IGLUPARK](https://www.facebook.com/events/1575810376524167/?ref=newsfeed): gingerbread cookies, marshmallows, the warmth of a bonfire, and many other delights.  
12:00–18:00 – [Kai Art Center](https://kai.center/en) (Peetri 12): “[On Fragile Grounds. Sirje Runge and Light](https://kai.center/en/exhibition/sirje-runge-on-fragile-grounds-sirje-runge-and-light).” A major solo exhibition spanning five decades of work by Sirje Runge (b. 1950, Tallinn), one of the central figures of Estonian postwar art.  
14:00 – [KAI CINEMA](https://www.kai.center/en/cinema) (Peetri 12): First Advent special screening: celebrate the beginning of the Christmas season with the beloved Estonian Christmas film “[Eia’s Christmas at Tondikaku](https://kinosoprus.ee/en/movie/eia-joulud-tondikakul).” (with English subtitles).  
14:30–19:30 – [BREWKLYN](https://www.facebook.com/brewklynee/) Craft Beer Café (Vesilennuki 22): warm spiced Christmas cider, plus a wide selection of snacks, soft drinks, and dog treats!  
13:00–20:00 – [LORE Bistro](https://www.lorebistroo.ee/en/intro/) (Peetri 12): LORE mulled wine (including non-alcoholic) and Christmas-themed dishes!  
13:00–18:00 – [PROTO Christmas Kiosk](https://www.prototehas.ee/en/event/christmas-kiosk/) on Noblessner Square: mini pancakes and waffle sticks, hot cocoa with marshmallows, gingerbread cookies, and much more!  
10:00–17:00 – [PÕHJALA Tap Room](https://www.pohjalabeer.com/visit/pohjala-tap-room) (Peetri 5): all-day breakfast with a special menu.  
9:00–18:00 – [ROBERT’S COFFEE](http://robertscoffee.ee/): delicacies to enjoy on site or to go: gingerbread latte, mocha, and gelato, plus warming Vana Tallinn mulled drink for children and adults, pumpkin soup, and carrot cakes!

![Advent SUnday in Noblessner 2025]()

### Advent SUnday in Noblessner 2025

On 30 November at 16:00, the lights of Noblessner's Christmas Tree will switched on festively!

![The Tall Ships Races Tallinn 2024]()

### The Tall Ships Races Tallinn 2024

The Tall Ships Races is Europe’s largest and oldest sail training ship regatta which will reach Tallinn from July 11th to 14th!

![December 2023 in Noblessner]()

### December 2023 in Noblessner

Events and offers in Noblessner in December and on Advent Sundays

![Advent Sunday in Noblessner 2023]()

### Advent Sunday in Noblessner 2023

On 3 December at 16.00, the lights of Noblessner’s Christmas Tree will be switched on festively with the boys’ choir ‘Juhanid’ of the National Opera.

![ARCHITECTURAL COMPETITION LAUNCHED FOR NOBLESSNER]()

### ARCHITECTURAL COMPETITION LAUNCHED FOR NOBLESSNER

Kodusadam OÜ announces an open architectural competition for seaside buildings and urban space in Noblessner, Tallinn.

![Tallinn Maritime Days 2023]()

### Tallinn Maritime Days 2023

Tallinn Maritime Days 2023 will take place from July 14 to 16! See Noblessner's program here

![Tallinn Maritime Days 2022]()

### Tallinn Maritime Days 2022

Tallinn Maritime Days 2022 will take place this year from 25 to 28 in August! See Noblessner's program here.

![Advent Sunday in Noblessner 2021]()

### Advent Sunday in Noblessner 2021

Advent Sunday will be celebrated for the first time and lights on the Christmas tree will be lit at Noblessner Square on 28 November at 16.00!

![NEW APARTMENT BUILDING IN NOBLESSNER]()

### NEW APARTMENT BUILDING IN NOBLESSNER

An apartment building accommodating 148 apartments and 11 commercial spaces and featuring a spacious courtyard will be completed at the end of 2023 in Noblessner.

![Ironman Tallinn in Noblessner 7 and 8 August 2021]()

### Ironman Tallinn in Noblessner 7 and 8 August 2021

The Ironman Tallinn and Ironman Tallinn 70.3 triathlon competitions will be held on 7 and 8 August. The competition centre and finish will be located in Noblessner.

![New development project in Noblessner]()

### New development project in Noblessner

Kodusadam OÜ, a joint venture of AS BLRT Grupp and AS Merko Ehitus Eesti, has decided to launch a new real estate development project in Noblessner.

![Noblessner won the international award]()

### Noblessner won the international award

Noblessner district won the highest real estate award in the Baltics.

### Contact

# Kai Art Centre

The Kai Art Centre is **a seaside cultural hub in the Noblessner seafront quarter** that fascinatingly combines the history and architecture of the area with contemporary art and culture.  
  
There are 3 to 5 large-scale art projects each year, accompanied by extensive public programmes, in the renovated submarine factory.  
  
Kai is open to all - top-class food and drink venues on the first floor offer culinary experiences. The only cinema in North Tallinn that is operated by Cinema Sõprus is open 7 days a week. A wide selection of national and international art literature can be found in the Lugemiku bookshop.

Free with Tallinn Card!

# Kai Art Center in Tallinn, Estonia

Kai Art Center in Tallinn’s Noblessner Port Quarter is an amazing place where people can touch history and modern art as well as arrange cultural events. Kai was founded in 2019 by the Estonian Contemporary Art Development Center (ECADC), a nonprofit contemporary art organization that supports contemporary Estonian art and helps to make it more internationally visible.

The Kai Art Center is located in a spacious two-story building that used to house a secret factory for the construction and repair of submarines.

The center invites both foreign and Estonian artists to exhibit their works. At the moment visitors can enjoy Tallinn-based video artist Holger Loodus’ “18 Moments of Spring” exhibition. Two meditative video installations are created especially for Kai’s unique space – walking through a wall of waterfalls gives the viewer both a spatial and calming experience.

Kai Art Center is also home to the only cinema in Northern Tallinn, operated by Sõprus Cinema, as well as an art book store run by independent publisher Lugemik.

After viewing exhibitions or watching a movie, guests can have a bite on the first floor of the center, where several delicious restaurants are located.

Information about events and exhibitions is available at www.kai.center/en

To stay up to date with the news, follow Kai on social networks:  
[www.facebook.com/ecadc](http://www.facebook.com/ecadc)  
[www.instagram.com/kaicenter](http://www.instagram.com/kaicenter)

Photos of the exhibition: Anu Vahtra

# Kai Art Center

Peetri 12, Noblessner, Tallinn

Wed–Sun 12–18

[Kai Art Center](https://kai.center/en) is a contemporary art center located at the seaside Noblessner harbor complex in Tallinn, Estonia. A century-old former secret submarine plant now serves as a space for [exhibitions](https://www.kai.center/en/exhibitions), the art house cinema [Sõprus](https://kinosoprus.ee/en), an international residency program, and a [co-working office](https://www.kai.center/en/space-rental#shared-office) for cultural organizations. Kai produces two to three large-scale exhibitions a year and hosts international researchers and curators year-round. Recent projects include solo exhibitions by Flo Kasearu, Shezad Dawood, Merike Estna, Patricia Piccinini, Shoplifter, Tuomas A. Laitinen and Kristina Õllek among many others. Since opening in 2019, Kai has become a preeminent contemporary art institution in the Baltics.

Kai Art Center was founded by the Estonian Contemporary Art Development Center (ECADC), a nonprofit contemporary art organization that supports contemporary Estonian art and helps to make it more internationally visible.

Kai’s neighbors include:  
[Temnikova and Kasela Gallery](http://temnikova.ee/)  
[LORE Bistro](https://noblessner.ee/en/lore/)  
[UMA Restaurant](https://noblessner.ee/en/uma/)  
[Lessner Bar](https://noblessner.ee/en/lessner/)  
KOT

Webpage: [kai.center/en](http://kai.center/)Facebook: <https://www.facebook.com/ecadc/>Instagram: <https://www.instagram.com/kaicenter/>

![](https://noblessner.ee/wp-content/uploads/Kai.png)
